rights_of_access.description: Democratic principles require prompt access to inspect, copy or receive copies of public books and records. All public books and records must be open at all times during office hours to any person.
rights_of_access.conditions: Open during office hours; prompt access required; applies to any person
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Policy declaration emphasizes promptness; no residency requirement
rights_of_access.request_tips: Assert: 'NRS 239.001 and 239.010 require prompt access to public records during office hours. Please provide immediate access to [records].'

rights_of_access.description: Within 5 business days, entity must: allow inspection/copying, notify if not in custody, provide estimate if available within 30 days, or cite specific statute denying access. Failure to act within 5 days deemed denial.
rights_of_access.conditions: 5 business days for response; four response options; deemed denied if no action
rights_of_access.applies_to: All public records requests in Nevada
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Clear accountability - silence equals denial after 5 days
rights_of_access.request_tips: Cite deadline and deemed denial: 'NRS 239.0107 requires response within 5 business days. Failure to respond will be deemed denial, providing grounds for judicial review.'

rights_of_access.subcategory: Burden of Proof on Agency / Narrow Construction
rights_of_access.description: Agency denying request as confidential has burden of proving by preponderance of evidence that record is confidential. Any statute making record confidential must be strictly and narrowly construed.
rights_of_access.conditions: Burden on agency to prove confidentiality; strict construction of exemptions
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Strong presumption of openness; agencies must affirmatively prove exemption
rights_of_access.request_tips: Assert burden: 'NRS 239.009 and 239.008 require you to prove by preponderance that records are confidential and construe exemptions strictly and narrowly. Please provide evidence supporting your claimed exemption.'

rights_of_access.subcategory: Actual Cost Standard with Fee Schedule Posting
rights_of_access.description: Fees may not exceed actual cost. Entity may adopt policy to waive fees. Must post fee schedule in conspicuous location.
rights_of_access.conditions: Limited to actual cost; waiver policy permitted; public posting required
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Transparency about fees through posting requirement; discretionary waiver supports public interest access
rights_of_access.request_tips: Request fee info: 'NRS 239.052 requires posting of fee schedule and limits fees to actual cost. Please direct me to your posted schedule and confirm fees reflect only actual costs.'

rights_of_access.subcategory: Prioritized District Court Review with Attorney Fees
rights_of_access.description: Person denied access may apply to district court for order permitting inspection/copying or requiring provision of copies. Court shall give priority to proceedings. If person prevails, court may award costs and reasonable attorney fees.
rights_of_access.conditions: District court jurisdiction; prioritized proceedings; discretionary attorney fees for prevailing party
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Priority treatment ensures fast resolution; fee provision makes enforcement viable
rights_of_access.request_tips: Warn of court action: 'NRS 239.011 and 239.012 authorize prioritized district court proceedings with potential attorney fee awards if I prevail. Please reconsider to avoid litigation.'
